units.title: High‑resolution clustering and annotation
units.text: We clustered cells at high resolution in each dataset and assigned cell annotations based on known marker gene expression and differential expression between clusters (Supplementary Table 2).
units.rationale: Describes the core step of grouping cells and labeling them for downstream analysis.

units.title: Assessment of data‑integration methods
units.text: We assessed 12 different data-integration methods using the proportion of cell types in each organoid sample and compared the similarity of each cell type with counterparts in adult and fetal tissues and selected scPoli to generate an integrated embedding of all organoid cells, enabling a cohesive representation of the diverse data.
units.rationale: Outlines the systematic evaluation and selection of an integration algorithm.

units.title: Construction of the integrated organoid atlas
units.text: We integrated all cells and defined 5 cell types at level 1, 48 cell types at level 2 and 51 cell subtypes at level 3.
units.rationale: Specifies the creation of a hierarchical cell‑type atlas from the integrated data.

units.title: Cytokine treatment of ASC‑derived ileum organoids
units.text: We generated ASC-derived ileal organoids in control media or media supplemented with TNF and receptor activator of nuclear factor-κB ligand (RANKL), and performed scRNA-seq after 6 days of treatment.
units.rationale: Provides a concrete experimental manipulation and downstream profiling step.

units.title: Viral and inflammatory perturbation experiment
units.text: We treated ASC-derived ileum organoids with cytokines for 24 h and performed scRNA-seq on control (4,191 cells) and treated samples from the same batch (viral response, 3,305 cells; inflammation, 2,158 cells).
units.rationale: Details a perturbation protocol and the associated single‑cell sequencing.

units.title: Projection of new datasets onto HEOCA
units.text: We used the sc2HEOCA toolkit to project new organoid datasets onto the integrated HEOCA through nearest neighbor analysis and cell annotation through label transfer.
units.rationale: Describes the computational step for mapping external data onto the reference atlas.

units.title: Distance‑to‑atlas analysis
units.text: Distance-to-atlas analysis revealed that, compared with the control sample, both viral response and inflammation samples had higher distances in all cell types.
units.rationale: Summarizes a quantitative assessment of perturbation impact relative to the reference.

units.title: Scaffold‑guided colon organoid culture
units.text: We generated ASC-derived colon organoids on a scaffolded hydrogel chip model, and assessed cell‑type proportions over time points (day 4, 20.45%; day 14, 54.03%; day 21, 66.97%).
units.rationale: Provides a stepwise culture protocol with temporal sampling.

units.title: Integration and mapping of lung organoid data
units.text: We integrated lung organoid data from 52 samples and 13 publications, generating a human lung organoid cell atlas (HLOCA) and projected organoid cells onto fetal and adult reference atlases.
units.rationale: Outlines the creation of a lung‑specific atlas and its comparative projection.

units.title: Disease‑state assessment of colon cancer organoids
units.text: We projected colon cancer organoid datasets to the HEOCA, annotated cell types, assessed cell‑type proportion, and performed differential expression analysis to identify cancer‑specific markers.
units.rationale: Describes a workflow for evaluating disease relevance using the reference atlas.
